sentences.english: At very high intensities, nuclear radiations cause itching and tingling of the skin.
sentences.chinese: 當核輻射強度很高時，它能使皮膚感到發癢和刺痛。

sentences.english: A worker is screened for radiation before entering the emergency operation center at the nuclear plant.
sentences.chinese: 進入應急指揮中心前，工作人員接受核輻射檢查。

sentences.english: But I am still suspect for crime against the radiation safety law.
sentences.chinese: 可我目前仍是一名涉嫌違反核輻射安全法的嫌疑犯。

sentences.english: Nuclear radiation, invisible and insidious, gives us the creeps.
sentences.chinese: 核輻射的無形性和潛伏性令人類聞風喪膽。

sentences.english: This would be a protective wind that would blow most of the radiation out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 這種風向可能將大多數核輻射吹向大海。

sentences.english: And as we get closer to the nuclear zone ourselves, the road gets emptier and emptier.
sentences.chinese: 當我們接近核輻射區時，道路變得越來越空寂。

sentences.english: Here's more on radiation sickness and how to combat it.
sentences.chinese: 本文有更多關於核輻射疾病和如何預防的知識。

sentences.english: The equipment was contaminated with radiation and abandoned as well.
sentences.chinese: 機械設備由於受到了核輻射而被拋棄。

sentences.english: Apitherapy effective protection of nuclear radiation-induced damage.
sentences.chinese: 蜂療能有效防護核輻射導致的傷害。

sentences.english: Will there be any sort of environmental hazards? ei. Radioactivity, biohazards, etc.
sentences.chinese: 會有環境破壞嗎？比如核輻射，生化災難之類的。

sentences.english: Nuclear radiation can cause ionization or excitation material, it is called ionizing radiation.
sentences.chinese: 核輻射可以使物質引起電離或激發，故稱爲電離輻射。

sentences.english: Silly city people panic buying salt, afraid that all sea salt from today on will have been exposed to radiation.
sentences.chinese: 小市民瘋狂搶購鹽，恐怕日後的海鹽受到核輻射。

sentences.english: There are many reasons why humans fear radiation so intensely.
sentences.chinese: 對於人們爲何如此恐慌核輻射有許多原因。

sentences.english: Tests showed that radiation caused damage to the X chromosome in sperm, Dr Scherb said.
sentences.chinese: 實驗表明核輻射會對精子的X染色體造成損害。

sentences.english: The proportion of nuclear radiation-induced increase of nearly 1%.
sentences.chinese: 核輻射導致這一比例上升近1%。

sentences.english: Potassium iodide pills are not "radiation antidotes".
sentences.chinese: 鉀片碘片都並非“核輻射解毒劑”。

definition: to shoot accidentally while polishing a gun/(fig.) a minor incident that sparks a war
